Title.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a cardiac surgery center

Intervention.evidence: the intervention involved coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) of the proximal right coronary artery and the left anterior descending artery

Objective.evidence: The study underscores the importance of timely identification and management of coronary insufficiency to prevent refractory VF.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the resolution of VF episodes, assessed immediately post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Blinding.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study was not a randomized controlled trial

Result_Outcome.evidence: CABG successfully resolved the VF, allowing the patient to be weaned from CPB and transferred to the intensive care unit.

Trial_Registration.evidence: no trial registration or funding information is applicable

Funding.evidence: no trial registration or funding information is applicable
